bibl.title: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand v. M. Angelique. Order
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Levin and Sister Superior M. Angelique for a writ of certiorari} No.1078 Order

This matter coming on upon the petition by Yvonne Le Fevre, Marie Le Fevre and Georgete Normand for a writ of habeas corpus, and the return of James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, and said petitioners appearing by their attorney, H. Gill, and respondents appearing by Edard E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, and the Court being fully advised, and finding the facts and causes of the detention of the petitioners by the respondents to be as set forth in the return, and further findings as a matter of law that the only action warranted by the respondents and the Goverment under those facts was the return of the petitioners to Victoria, British Columbia, at the expense of the ship which brought them to this country;

It is therefore ordered, adjudged and decreed that the petitioners, and each pf them, be and are hereby remanded to thecustody of James P. Lavin, Immigrant Inspector, to be by him placed and returned upon the Steamship Rosalie, to be by said vessel and at its own exprense returned to Victoria, British Columbia.
Done in open Court this 19th day of Febuary, 1903.
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHOINTON
In the Application of Jas. vs. P Savin et al for writ of curtivsani
Filed Feby 19 1903 A. Reeves Avres Clerk By PM Hapkins Deputy
